title: Accordion 1 - ideal settings and options
body:
• You should only use this component strategically, when it is useful to hide part of the content for learning purposes. Often a simple text component with a list would do.  
  • The recommended maximum number of items (accordions) is eight (8) in a row within a component.  
    • Too many accordions makes the experience more taxing for all learners regardless if they use assistive technologies or not.  
  • Item Title is required. 
  • Instructions need to be added.
  • Properties:
    • set completion on: allitems
    • items should auto-collapse (selected - checkmark)
  • Settings
    • Is this optional? usually No (empty). 
      • Yes (selected - checkmark) when the accordion is used for a long description of an informative image.
    • Is this available? Yes (selected - checkmark)
    • Is this hidden? No (empty)
    • Is this visible? Yes (selected - checkmark)

title: Graphic 1 - ideal settings and options
body:
• Alternative (alt) text is required for informative images and images of text. 
  • Settings
    • Is this optional?
      • No (empty). 
        • Informative images
      • Yes (selected - checkmark)
        • Decorative images and no text
    • Is this available? Yes (selected - checkmark)
    • Is this hidden? No (empty)
    • Is this visible? Yes (selected - checkmark)
  • Extension: Page level progress
    • Is enabled 
      • Yes (selected - checkmark)
        • Informative image with alt text
        • has a title above it
        • may have text above it
      • No (empty)
        • decorative image, and
        • there is no title, and
        • no text is above it.

title: Narrative ideal settings and options
body:
• Recommend a minimum of 2 and a maximum of 6 slides in a single component. (NEW)
    • Too many slides makes the experience more taxing for all learners regardless if they use assistive technologies or not.
  • Narrative Display Title is required. (NEW)
  • Recommend keeping the “Move navigation to text area” unselected, which uses larger navigation buttons placed with the image. (better user experience) (NEW)
    • Note the reading order is the same (title, image alt, body content) regardless of placement. The difference is the size of the buttons that learners can interact with.

Image (alt text)

  • Do not include quotation marks because this will break the code and will not announce the content within the quotations.
  • Do not include the text displayed in the image in the alt text. Any text displayed in the image needs to be included in either the Narrative Display Title and/or the Narrative Main text. The reasoning is that at 400% the screen reader will not announce the image alt text.
    • For the alt text if it is a decorative image include the word “Decorative.” or “Décorative.”.

Narrative Strapline text

Narrative Strapline text needs to be the same text as the Narrative Display title. The Narrative Strapline text replaces the Narrative Display Title when the screen is magnified to 400%.

Recommended settings:

  • Is this optional? unchecked
  • Is this available? checked
  • Is this hidden? unchecked
  • Is this visible? checked
